All Implemented Interfaces:
junit.framework.Test
public class LocalRuleExecutionSetProviderTest
extends junit.framework.TestCase

Test the javax.rules.admin.LocalRuleExecutionSetProvider class.

Perfoms the following tests:

  • Basic API tests. testLocalRuleExecutionSetProvider()
    • Create Instance
    • InputStream
    • Reader
Note:
See the TCK documentation for more information on the rule execution set definition that is used for testing this provider API. The actual loading of the rule execution set is handled by the TestCaseUtil class file.

Since:
JSR-94 1.0
Version:
1.0

testLocalRuleExecutionSetProvider

public void testLocalRuleExecutionSetProvider()
                                       throws java.lang.Exception
Test the compliance for javax.rules.admin.LocalRuleExecutionSetProvider. Get the rule engine vendor specific implementation of the LocalRuleExecutionSetProvider via the RuleServiceProvider specified in the tck.conf configuration file. Get the RuleAdministrator from this service provider which will have a reference to a LocalRuleExecutionSetProvider. The test will continue with constructing a RuleExecutionSet from an InputStream and a Reader. In both cases the "tck_res_1.xml" rule execution set definition will be used as input.

Description:

  • Create Instance
    • Fail: If any errors occur when trying to get a reference to the LocalRuleExecutionSetProvider.
    • Succeed: If a reference to an instance of the LocalRuleExecutionSetProvider is successfully obtained.
  • InputStream
    • Fail: If any errors occur during the creation of a RuleExecutionSet from an InputStream.
    • Succeed: If a RuleExecutionSet can successfully be created from an InputStream.
  • Reader
    • Fail: If any errors occur during the creation of a RuleExecutionSet from a Reader.
    • Succeed: If a RuleExecutionSet can successfully be created from a Reader.
See Also:
TestCaseUtil.getRuleExecutionSetInputStream(java.lang.String), TestCaseUtil.getRuleExecutionSetReader(java.lang.String)
